name: Sandals Grande Riviera Beach & Villa Golf Resort

reviews.title: Potential for Greatness - but not quite there yet!
reviews.text: Hello, Fellow Travellers!

reviews.title: WOW! That's all all we can say!
reviews.text: We just got back today from a week's stay at this resort (April 24 - May 1, 2011). I travelled with my husband and several friends. We have travelled many times to Cuba and the Dominican Republic, but it was our first time to Jamaica.

reviews.title: Wow! Loved it.
reviews.text: The Bus Ride:

reviews.title: Stunning Views - Impeccable Service
reviews.text: First and foremost, there is an hour and forty-five minute bus ride to the resort (you'll stop along the way for a bathroom break and you can buy refreshments - you'll also do this on the return trip!). Even though I may be getting ahead of myself here, it's important to note that when your vacation is over, you'll be taken back to the airport so that you are there 2 hours before your flight (*you can add another 2 hours to your travel time as well, as it takes almost this long to get back to the airport from the resort).

reviews.title: Don't believe the negative reviews! Our stay was wonderful!
reviews.text: Check-In/Room Assignment:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a large property consisting of two sides – the Riviera side and the Manor side. The Riviera side is the side with the beach. The Manor side is across a road and requires a bus transfer. During our stay, the shuttles regularly departed at ten minute intervals.
reviews.title: Sandals did not live up to its hype - an OK experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the Riviera side. The grounds were beautiful and lush, with lots of winding walkways and hidden areas for couples to enjoy, including swings, hammocks, and Bali beds. The beach on this side is nice, but short and narrow in places. There are lots of water sports available, and there are lots of shaded areas on the beach as well. One nice feature is the huge pier area. It is very nice for walking, massages, or relaxing in a swing. There are several pools, Jacuzzis, bars and restaurants on this side also. Many of the restaurants offer outside seating overlooking the water. One restaurant – Arizona- has tables set up directly on the beach in the evening so you can dine with your toes in the sand.
reviews.title: Love Sandals But Not This Location - Beware (detailed review)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Riviera Deluxe room in the Bamboo building. I chose this room based on price point and the fact that it guaranteed us a balcony. Based on those critieria, I was satisfied but it was by no means luxurious. Room was clean and freshly painted, but bathroom was in desperate need of renovations. The tub was extremely small and narrow (I’m 5’4’’and a size 7 and it was tight for me), tiles were cracked, a lot of mildew around tub. On the Riviera side, I would definitely recommend an oceanfront room in the Riviera Building – these were quite nice and fully renovated.
reviews.title: Sandals Grande Ocho Rios is AWESOME!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Manor side of the resort consists of the largest pool, rock-climbing wall and the villas with private and shared pools. There is a jitney service offered to transport villa guests to the main Manor building. The Manor building itself was also beautiful. Restaurants on this side include Orchids, Manor, and Marketplace with outdoor terrace dining at night. There are cabanas around the pool available at an extra cost.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants: We were not overly impressed with the food quality at this resort. Given the Sandals reputation, the food was disappointing. Breakfast and lunch buffets were decent – food was fresh even if variety was limited. The a la carte dining was disappointing. The food never seemed to taste as good as it looked, and dishes were often lukewarm. Service was also slow, water and wine was not refilled. Drink orders often did not even arrive until after appetizers were finished. There was also limited availability at certain times – the resort does not provide 24 hour food service. Our best evening meals were at Bayside and Valentinos.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service, Not so great weather...

likes.liked: — The service was friendly and attentive.
likes.disliked: — The food was just alright and the beds were hard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So much has been written I won't go over the whole experience just try & mention some helpful points.
reviews.title: Great tiime, cheaper & less luxurious than some Sandals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Don't Let the Reviews Worry you, We had an Amazing Time!

likes.liked: — Our Room, pool, beach, and butlers

reviews.title: Loved every second!

likes.liked: — The staff, the gorgeous beach, the food and drinks, everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If staying on the Riviera side & you like to sit on the balcony in the evening in the sun, get a garden view room as the resort faces north & ocean views are in the shade.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were at Sandals Grande Riviera from March 11-19, 2011. This was our fourth Sandals trip, and all have been different resorts. We chose this one because at the time of booking the price was very reasonable, but I was a bit nervous after reading negative reviews after we booked.
reviews.title: Had a great trip - don't believe the negative reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a great time at this resort which will get even better when the renovations are completed. The people who complain about the construction are the same people who would complain that the resort needs renovations. The construction was not an issue - Kimonos, the Japanese restaurant, is almost completed. This will be beautiful when done, right on the beach.
reviews.title: Worst All-Inclusive Ever!! - DO NOT GO!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I've done with our other Sandals trips, I did a lot of research before booking and knew that the ride would be 1 hour 45 minutes, but the ride was on the main road, alongside the ocean most of the way, definitely not terrifying at all. Check-in, as always, was stress-free, and the front desk people were quite friendly and efficient. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful - many thanks to Marva (Marvelous) the concierge who greeted us every morning at her desk with a smile.
reviews.title: WHAT A NIGHTMARE -STAY AWAY!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was on the fifth floor of the Riviera building and was very clean and seemed to be newly renovated. Our maid was great - always had our room cleaned with new towels (and a cute towel animal) by 11 a.m. every day.
reviews.title: I cannot say enough about Shelly Kelly! Just the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good, some meals better than others. We loved eating out on the beach at Neptunes one night, and our waiter, Courtney, was so efficient and friendly. We ate breakfast each morning at Bayside for the buffet which was good. The one thing we were disappointed in was that the restaurant on the Pier, Gordon's, was restricted to guests with butlers. This was the first time we have encountered this restriction at any of the Sandals we have been to.
reviews.title: wonderful time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to booking our vacation, I spent many hours researching Caribbean vacation options, including hotels, privately-owned rentals and several all-inclusive operations. As my fiancee and I are overworked, underpaid and only able to vacation once every one or two years, spending five percent of our annual income for one week of relaxation means that we read a lot of reviews so we can get the most bang for our vacation bucks.
reviews.title: Sandals Grande Ocho Rios: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Unfortunately, I found many of the reviews of Sandals Grande Ocho Rios unhelpful as they seemed to fall into two categories; the overly-vague "everything was wonderful and I had the best time of my life" variety or, on the opposite end of the spectrum, the overly-detailed and angry "Sandals Ocho Rios was a big ripoff, there were bugs in my room and they didn't pick up my bags at 9:00 like they said" type.
reviews.title: 5 Year Low Worst Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008
reviews.text: Sandals Grande Ocho Rios does deliver in some ways on the company's promise of a "Luxury Included Vacation". In some ways they're off the mark just a bit and could easily improve with some better management and attention to detail. In some ways (in the ways that mattered most to us, unfortunately) they fail miserably and frankly, are downright misleading in their promotional materials. Here's my summary, which most will find overly-detailed already, but if you want an honest review on all aspects of the resort, I made this site just after returning (this is a personal site, not a commercial site): http://sandalsreviews.googlepages.com/sandalsochoriosreviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Beautiful, well-maintained resort
reviews.title: One of the Greatest Places on Earth!!!
Inattentive & Stingy
reviews.text: Having just spent a year in landlocked, war ravaged Afghanistan, I wanted to take my wife to a warm, oceanside resort where we could relax with no worries and all of our needs taken care of. We booked a last minute package with Sandals and were excited by the carefully crafted website of the resort. We arrived amid some confusion as to which side of the resort we were supposed to be on. One employee said he would take care of us. He went off and we never saw him again. 15 minutes later, another employee asked if we were being helped and we said yes, but not very well. She jumped in and found our reservation and got us to our room. When we got to our room, the keys did not work without significant struggle. Later a lock smith came, worked on the lock, getting it as workable as he could, then he showed us how we had to manipulate the lock to get it to work. Not a good sign. We then tried to sign up for internet, which was not included in this "all inclusive" resort. After several attempts, I was instructed by the computer to contact the front desk. I did so 3 times, but they were not able to help except to say that a technician would call me. When I asked when, she did not answer, saying only that she would call the technician now. We waited about 20 minutes but got no call. Note, later that night, we finally were able to sign in and purchase a weeks worth of internet for about $43. Very hungry we left for dinner. We went to Valentinos, a place with a dress code. Serving Italian fare, they do not offer you grated cheese for your soup salad or pasta unless you ask for it. Dinner took over an hour to come out, despite a very narrow selection of items to choose from. We had advised an employee that we were going to leave for a buffet layout because we were too hungry to wait any longer when our food was finally brought out. We ate and the food was ok. The fettucini Alfredo was bland, no trace of garlic detected and of course, I had to ask for grated cheese. With the cheese, it had some flavor. We ate and left for another place to have dessert. Before we entered the Arizona Grill, I asked an employee if they would be able to get me a cognac or port from the bar to have with my dessert or should i go to the bar and get it myself (I had seen Remy Martin at the bar earlier) She asked us to sit down and she said she would find out. She returned to say that they had no more cognac or port. She offered me their house merlot and I said ok. My dessert came out, but my wine did not arrive until i was nearly finished my desert. This i learned was typical. The next morning I went to the buffet breakfast. I had to pick from the crumbs of bacon that remained even though breakfast was still going for another 90 minutes. Perhaps I had stumbled on a rare instance where the staff was caught by a surprise rush? No. The next day at lunch, a Caribbean Beach Party Buffet, the salad dressing had run dry. No attention to customer needs here. Allowing food items to run dry at an all inclusive is simply a sign of stinginess. The second night at dinner, we ate at the Reef Terrace. An employee took our order for drinks - Ice Tea and Merlot. We never saw him again. We had to place a second order for Ice Tea and Merlot. This time we got the Merlot, two glasses which I took knowing that getting a second glass the night before was a challenge. We again asked for Ice Tea. The third time was the charm, my wife finally getting the ice tea. We ordered. I asked if I could have soup instead of an appetizer and also have a greek salad. No problem. My wife ordered an appetizer of shrimp. The waiter brought out two shrimp appetizers. I reminded him that this is not what I ordered. He returned with the greek salad but I never did get my soup. Mixed drinks are made up of well brand liquors and most bartenders give a very light pour at that. The exception was at the Manor's swim up bar. I paid a visit to the sing along piano bar and was amazed at how the piano player waived off every request from the song book made by the guests, calling out songs that he insisted were more fun. Finally, after the guests stood firm at the end of the night, he played part of a requested song. We rode into the resort with a couple that was on their honeymoon and had booked a two week stay. The next day, the bride said she was so disappointed with the experience. We felt bad for her. On the brighter side, Jamaica has warm weather and if you go to the well enough, you will get your drinks. Compared to our truly all inclusive experience at Super Clubs in Negril, this was very poor. As I write this we are half way through our stay. We are making the best of it and I am truly grateful not to be in Afghanistan where drinks are not available and vigilance against suicide bombers is always required.

reviews.title: Trip was amazing! Who is writing these bad reviews...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sandals Grande Ocho Rios is indeed a luxiourious escape in my opinion. My wife and I first stayed in October of 2009 and enjoyed ourselves so much we saved money as quickly as we could to get back. The people at Sandals and Jamaicans in general seem so happy and concerned that you are happy as well.
reviews.title: Second time better than the first, cant wait for third

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first trip we made the weather did dampen, so to speak, as new travelers to the Carribean we did not know we were traveling in the Rainy Season but we made the best of it. The rain generally came and went fairy quickly with the exception of one day that we took a tour up the mountain to Nine Mile. It litterally poored the whole tour but we had so much fun anyway the mountains were beautiful and we got to see the real Jamaica.
reviews.title: the best most relaxing vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: The first trip was only a few days and we wanted more and booked the second trip for May the following year. I anxiously checked weather forcasts to see what we were in for unfortunately looked like rain. When we got there booking a seven day trip this time I found that weather forcasts are not real reliable as it rained for about ten minutes one day and was beautiful every other day. When we arrived we were greated with cool towels and taken into the concierge lounge to complete checkin and given champange which was quite delicious. My wife and I enjoyed a concierge villa suite with a shared private pool (2-4 villa suites per pool) on both trips (the first time this was a offered upgrade after recieving a call from Sandals for quite a good discount). If you want to truely relax this is the way to do it. We would start each day waking whenever drinking very good blue mountain coffee we would make ourselves provided in our suites kitchenette. We sat outside on our private balcony overlooking our pool and the beautiful tropical gardens the ocean easily visible in the background enjoying the breathtaking views. We split our time by booking a few excursions which were enjoyable similar to the quality you find with cruise ship excursions. The other days we spent at the resort relaxing at our suite, watching sports at the manor bar, in the villa pool, having cocktails from our in room bar (vodka, gin, rum, whiskey, wine, champange) or a carib beer from the fridge which was restocked daily with soda, beer, juices all included. We spent time just exploring the vast grounds which Sandals takes great care of, spent time at the main manor pool, swim up bar and pool on the Riviera side, sitting on the beach and taking a cooling dip in the ocean. We usually relaxed trough breakfast time only making the buffet style breakfast service once which was as good as breakfast buffets get. For lunch we usually ate at one of the grills either at the beach or the manor pool. We found nightly entertainment and great dining again similar to cruise ship dining only with more choices of restaurants, we enjoyed a 5 course dinner nightly with the exception of the evenings we dined buffet style and always topped off with coffee and desert. After days in the sun, we usually retired to the suite a bit earlier than say what you would in vegas we would take a dip in the pool, hang out with the couple from the next suite and go to bed only to look forward to the next day. We hated to leave Jamaica and apparantly they wanted to keep us too as our plane was very late and missed our connection back in the US ending up with an extra day off work, yeah.... can't want to "Soon come back".
reviews.title: Anniversary vacation to Sandals Grande Riveria in Ocho Rios, Jamaica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and sincere staff, everything was nearby or there was a shuttle. Loved learning to sail with Dwayne. Food was excellant...can't say enough.
reviews.title: Great value for a couples getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got off plane in Jamaica and had to stand in line to immigration for 2 hours! Don't fly in on a Saturday as everyone else is too! Bus ride to the resort was 90 minutes but was good. Driver was funny and friendly. We stopped at a little store for a bathroom break and to get a drink about half way. Got to Sandals resort and they greeted us with cool towels to wipe your face with. Got to our room. It was the wrong room. We called down and explained. She apologized and said there weren't anymore rooms to put us in for the night but would put us in the right room the next day. So we were alright with that. Got in our new room after 1:30pm that next day. Room was very nice with a balcony, table and chairs with a view of the ocean. It was magnificent! After first night in room, realized bed was broke, called maintenance that next morning and they came and fixed that day. A couple days later we came back to room and air conditioner had leaked all over floor. Again, called maintenance and they fixed that day. Room was very clean and our housekeeper constantly kept clean towels and wash cloths in our room. Bed made daily and turn down service nightly. The resort is beautiful and well maintained. Staff are all very friendly and always helpful. Alcoholic Drinks are a little weak, but that was fine with us since we're not big drinkers so we didn't end up drunk. You could ask for them to be stronger though. Service at some of the restaurants were slow..sometimes very slow. The best restaurants there in our opinion was, Valentino's, Kimono's and The Reef Terrace. Service was superb and food was excellent!!!!! Neptune's was by far the worst service. Dinner took 2 hours because they were so slow. Some of the food tasted old and was cold. They even were out of certain foods and you had to pick something else. The pools were great!! Swim up bars were awesome! One pool was really dirty though with leaves and sand. Hadn't been cleaned in awhile. Lots of cool activities going on. Water sports were fun. Excursions were awesome! The Catamaran to Dunn River Fall's was a blast! The staff on the Catamaran were top notch! The falls were alot of fun. We also went on tubing and zip line combo excursion. It was so much fun too. Staff were top notch again. On the excursion's, the tour guides expect you to tip if trip was good for you. Also bus from airport to resort expect you to tip. Same thing on way from resort to airport and also for bringing your luggage in. Excursion bus drivers expect a tip also. Otherwise you don't tip anywhere else. We really had a great time and was sad to see it end. There were a few things we were disappointed about, but overall we were very happy with trip. I would recommend this resort to others and I hope to stay at another Sandals resort in the future!
reviews.title: Great Service and Extremely Fun Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our fifth Sandals experience and, hands down, the absolute best. We were offered the butler/private suite with private pool upgrade and gladly accepted. Our butlers, Annistecia and Ryan, were outstanding: professional, warm, and friendly. The food was great, the atmosphere was fun-filled and relaxing. Learning more about the Sandals Foundation during the Sandals Select Dinner was eye-opening. We've added this outreach to our list of charities. Our foot reflexology massage at the Red Lane Spa was a blissful experience, and it was complimentary. Brian Roper, the General Manager, is doing a fabulous job as is the entire staff at Grande Riviera. Sandals and the two of us are celebrating a 30th anniversary this year. Here's to many more!
reviews.title: The honeymoon we never had"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: My husband and I returned from SGOR on Jan. 12. It's been interesting to read all the reviews, which differ widely - I think it all depends on your expectations. The incredible advertising campaign that Sandals has certainly leads you to expect a 5 star resort, which this is not. We got a good deal and didn't feel too terribly ripped off, but were expecting better food and service than we got. Without a butler, I would say this is a 3 and a half star place. A few things to keep in mind if you're considering this resort:

reviews.title: Top Ten Advice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I travelled here from Ireland. It took nearly 24 hours to get to Ocho Rios, so I had high expectations that our arduous journey would have been worth it. The mini bus journey from Kingston nearly finished me off. I cried from sheer terror and nausea, it was in a dirty Hiace van, held together with duct tape and a driver who smoked, chatted on his mobile and over took on blind hairpin bends. But because we had one of the best holidays we have ever had in Sandals Antigua two years previously I genuinely believed all would be well once we arrived.
reviews.title: Rum, Sun, Some Fun but No Luxury. At all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hmmm. Stayed in a Ciboney Villa - shared semi private pool - deck peeling, weathered, unkempt. My husband refused to spend time on the deck as it was so decrepit. Room itself was clean but decidedly worn out and shabby. There was a wierd kitchenette the purpose of which I never deduced. The bathroom was grim. Very 70's. Two of the pillows stank - they smelt like vomit. I have stayed in many hotels in my life and that was a first for me. We never managed to get our coffee or cream replaced by the chamber maid, even though we left tips and a note requesting some. Tips were taken though!
reviews.title: tropical paradise
JUNIOR HARRIS
reviews.text: Food was adequate, barely. We weren't left hungry but we weren't exactly thrilled by the poor choices, especially at lunchtimes when a proper sit down table d'hote menu didn't exist, just a buffet or pizza (which took us 1.30 hours to arrive one day)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The steak in Valentinos was the highlight of the 10 days. The calamari in Neptunes the low point. We were very surprised by the lack of finesse and choice, we had high hopes following our lovely stay in Antigua. Service was haphazard, usually very friendly but very inexperienced. Trainee staff work for a month for free to see if they make the cut. We seemed to meet most of them which made for some interesting mealtimes. One of the things I liked about Sandals in Antigua was the generously free flowing champagne at breakfast - my guilty pleasure! It was never offered in Ocho Rios and I had to hunt for it myself in the mornings! Trying to get a glass of wine at lunch and dinner took considerable effort, and patience. Staff milled around but there didn't seem to be a system in place. That was such a pity and made dining a frustrating experience to be honest. But we never complained, they work long days and aren't properly trained it would appear. Some of them have no hesitation in cadging cigarettes from guests. A gardener asked us for some Rum! We gave him half a bottle for his sheer chutzpah! Another first for me, but maybe that's part of the relaxed charm of Jamaica.
reviews.title: Best adult only all inclusive I have stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pools are VERY heavily clorinated, probably because there were no toilets near the pool bar in either end of the resort. Some people sat drinking all day but oddly enough rarely got out. Amazing bladder control I hope. There were no showers either to rinse off before or after using the pool. I found this very shocking.
